properties.areaDesc: Inland Kleberg; Jim Wells; Bee; Inland Nueces; Webb; Duval; McMullen; La Salle; Live Oak; Inland San Patricio
properties.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 3 at 3:20AM CST until March 4 at 7:00PM CST by NWS Corpus Christi TX
properties.description:
...FIRE WEATHER WATCH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON FOR INLAND COASTAL BEND
TO THE BRUSH COUNTRY...

.A frontal boundary will move through the coastal plains of south
Texas Wednesday morning. Much drier air will move in behind the
front with west winds becoming strong and gusty during the
afternoon. The winds combined with very low relative humidity will
bring critical fire weather conditions Wednesday afternoon.

The National Weather Service in Corpus Christi has issued a Fire
Weather Watch, which is in effect from Wednesday afternoon
through early Wednesday evening.

* AFFECTED AREA...La Salle...McMullen...Live Oak...Bee...Webb...
Duval...Jim Wells...Inland Kleberg...Inland Nueces...Inland
San Patricio.

* TIMING...From Noon Wednesday until 7 PM Wednesday.

* WIND...West to northwest winds 20 to 25 mph with gusts between
35 to 40 mph.

* HUMIDITY...Falling to 15 to 20 percent over the Brush Country
and 20 to 25 percent inland Coastal Bend.

* IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly.
Outdoor burning is not recommended.
properties.instruction:
A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions
are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible
Red Flag Warnings.

NWSheadline: FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR INLAND COASTAL BEND AND BRUSH COUNTRY
